required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Hearing Changes After Skull Base and Mastoid Surgery

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Deafness and Other Communication Disorders (NIDCD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure the potential effects of surgical drilling noise and/or vibration exposure on the hearing in the ear contralateral to the surgical site during skull-based surgeries

detailed_description.textblock: High-speed drills that are capable of producing elevated levels are used during skull based surgeries (Hilmi et al., 2011; Yu et al., 2014). Recently, it has been shown that surgical drilling may have a temporary effect on the amplitude of the otoacoustic emissions of the ear contralateral to the surgical site (Baradaranfar et al., 2015; Shenoy et al., 2015), however the temporary effects of surgical noise or vibration on the hearing of the non-surgical related ear needs to be better quantified. This study aims to to measure the potential effects of surgical drilling noise and/or vibration exposure on the hearing in the non operative ear, during surgical site during skull-based or mastoid surgeries. As part of the study patient will receive Audiometry for extended high frequencies, DPOAE, ECochG before and after the procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of 5dB or greater in DPOAE measurements between baseline/pre-surgery and post-surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-surgery, immediately after surgery, up to one month after surgery
primary_outcome.description: DPOAE measurement using Interacoustics Titan DPOAE440 measurement tool is 5dB or greater from pre-surgery measurement to post-surgery measurement

primary_outcome.measure: No change in DPOAE measurement between baseline/pre-surgery and post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: DPOAE measurement using interacoustics titan measurement tool has not changed or is less than 5dB from pre-surgery measurement to post-surgery measurement

arm_group.arm_group_label: Participants scheduled to undergo skull-based surgery
arm_group.description: Participants scheduled to undergo skull-based or mastoid surgery as part of their standard care will receive Audiometry for extended high frequencies, DPOAE, ECochG before and after the procedure in the non operated ear.

intervention.description: Audiometry for extended high frequencies, DPOAE, and, ECochG measurements will be collected before and after skull-based surgeries.
intervention.arm_group_label: Participants scheduled to undergo skull-based surgery

study_pop.textblock: Participants scheduled to undergo skull-based and mastoid surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- participants are undergoing a skull-based or mastoid surgery for treatment of an affected ear
- participants have normal or near-normal hearing thresholds in the un-operated ear
Exclusion Criteria:
- participants have hearing loss (PTA > 40 dB HL) in pure tone audiometry testing before surgery in the un-operated ear
- participants have medical conditions after the surgery which prevents having hearing tests
- participants have abnormal tympanometric results

reference.citation: Baradaranfar MH, Shahbazian H, Behniafard N, Atighechi S, Dadgarnia MH, Mirvakili A, Mollasadeghi A, Baradaranfar A. The effect of drill-generated noise in the contralateral healthy ear following mastoid surgery: The emphasis on hearing threshold recovery time. Noise Health. 2015 Jul-Aug;17(77):209-15. doi: 10.4103/1463-1741.160691.
